text: Jamaican English may mean: Jamaican Patois Jamaican English is a variety of English spoken in Jamaica. It uses parts of both American and British English. A simple example of this would be "Ku pon dis mama, dis yah mon yah'ead nuh good, truss mi." Which would mean "Look at this mom, this man is crazy, trust me." Category:Dialects of English
title: Jamaican English
